document.docAuthor: Gu, Xinyao, Jin, Daochao, Yi, Tianci & Guo, Jianjun
document.masterDocTitle: Contributions to the knowledge of Torrenticolid water mites (Acari: Hydrachnidia) in Doupengshan, China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Contributions to the knowledge of Torrenticolid water mites (Acari: Hydrachnidia) in Doupengshan, China

heading.emphasis: Key to the known species of the family Torrenticolidae in China . (modified to Gu et al . 2018, 2019)

paragraph.keyLead:
- Three pairs of acetabula, the tip of Cx-I with a seta-like extension, P-2 and P-3 both with a feathered seta on the ventral sur- face.............................................................
Testudacarus binodipalpis Guo & Jin, 2005

- P-4 short, not more than twice as long as W, P-5 with broad, blunt terminal setae................................................................................................
Neoatractides proclusteroseta Gu & Guo, 2018
3. Gnathosoma dorsal apodeme short, P-2 and P-3 with obvious ventral prolongations or hyaline expansions............... 4
- Gnathosoma dorsal apodeme long, P-2 and P-3 without projections on ventral side................................ 17

- Dorsal plate arrangements: 2+1, P-3 distal margin with denticles, P-4 stocky............................................................................
Torrenticola taiwanicus Pešić, Semenchenko, Chatterjee, Yam, Chan, 2011
5. Infracapitular rostrum short (<1/2 of gnathosoma dL)................................................ 6

- Palp robust and compact, P-2 shorter than P-4, Cx-IV with a prominent suture line of starting at right angle from genital field, laterally curved anteriorly........................
T . nanshihensis Pešić, Semenchenko, Chatterjee, Yam, Chan, 2011
7. P-3 with a triangular, relatively short ventral projection....................................................... 8

- P-3 with a very long tapering ventral projection which is curved distally, larger than projection on P-2..............................................................................
T . projectura Pešić, Chatterjee, Yam, Chan, 2012
8. Infracapitular bay deep, ventral apodeme L about two times of dorsal apodeme.................................... 9

- Infracapitular bay shallow, ventral apodeme L three times longer than dorsal apodeme.................
T . curta Jin, 1997

9. Idiosoma roundish, the lateral view of infracapitulum acute triangle-like...................
T . siamis Pešić & Smit, 2009

- Idiosoma elliptical, the lateral view of infracapitulum regular triangle-like................
T. trigona Gu & Guo
, sp. nov.

- Infracapitular bay V-shaped, posterior half of dorsal plate red.........................
T . alargada Goldschmidt, 2007

12. Dorsal apodeme of infracapitulum with a fine spine, AP close to the line of primary sclerotization, E
4
at the same level as the 3 rd pair of acetabula..................................................................
T. yanjinensis Jin, 1997

- Dorsal apodeme of infracapitulum with a broad spine, AP on the line of primary sclerotization, E
4
at the same level as the 4 th pair of acetabula....................................................................
T. dentipalpis Jin, 1997
13. The concavity between the ventral prolongations of P-4 small................................................. 14

- The concavity between the ventral prolongations of P-4 big and obvious, and with four setae on the ventral prolongations, idiosoma oblate..............................................................
T. fodingensis Gu & Guo, 2018

15. P-2 shorter than 1/3 palp L, idiosomal frontal margin with a convex outline.................
T. nipponica ( Enami, 1940 )

- P-2 longer than 1/3 palp L, ventral margin convex, ventrodistal protrusion bluntly pointed and slightly curved towards distal, gnathosoma elongated, chelicera long and straight................................
T. tenuichelicera Gu & Guo, 2018

16. The shape of gnathosoma elongated and compressed, idiosomal frontal margin with a flat outline, body pale yellow, Cx-II+III mL short.........................................................................
T. semicolor Viets, 1977

- The posterior segment of gnathosoma conspicuous and towering, body pale tawny, Cx-II+III mL relatively long............................................................................................
T. tetrapora Viets, 1935
- Idiosoma roundish or slightly oval, L/W ratio less than 1.5.................................................... 19

18. Idiosoma L/W ratio 1.6–1.9, frontal margin of idiosoma with a flat protrusion; E
4
posterior to Gf; gnathosoma dorsal apodeme pointed............................................
M. tuzovskyi Pešić, N. Kumar, K. Kumar & S. Kumar, 2006

- Idiosoma L/W ratio 1.5–1.6, E
4
at the same level as the posterior edge of Gf; gnathosoma dorsal apodeme with a blunt end............................................................................
M. xiaoxiensis Gu & Guo, 2019
19. Gnathosoma and palp normal, chelicera more or less curved.................................................. 20

- Gnathosoma relatively long and slender, palp comparatively short and stocky, chelicera straight.
M. pinapalpis ( Cook, 1967 )

21. E
4
on the same line with the 4 th (male) or 5 th (female) pair of acetabula, Idiosoma roundish.......................... 22

- E
4
posterior to Gf, Idiosoma oval, D
2
anterior to the anterior edge of muscle scars, gnathosoma proportionally short and tapering gradually towards the distal end, P-4 much narrower...................................
M. setivalvata ( Cook, 1967 )

22. The tip of Cx-I sharp and with a long elongated cuticular extension..............
M. hamatapodemus Gu & Guo
, sp. nov.

- The tip of Cx-I with a short and small cuticle extension.............................
M. macrocorpis Gu & Guo, 2019
23. Infracapitular bay V-shaped, P-2 longer or shorter than P-4................................................... 24

- Infracapitular bay U-shaped, frontal margin of idiosoma distinctly concave, P-2 almost as long as P-4..................................................................................................
M. stadleri (Walter, 1924)

24. Gnathosoma rostrum short (1/5 of gnathosoma dL) and tapering abruptly towards the distal end, gnathosoma dorsal apodeme longer than ventral apodeme, and with a blunt end, frontal margin of idiosoma concave, P-2 shorter than P-4.........................................................................................
M. oxystomus (K. Viets, 1935 )

- Gnathosoma rostrum relatively long and gradually tapering towards the distal end, gnathosoma dorsal apodeme L equal in length with the ventral apodeme and with the ventral serrated teeth, Cx-I with seta-like cuticle extensions at the tip, dorsodistal seta on P-3 smooth and longer than P-4, P-2 longer than P-4................................
M. serratifera Jin, 1997
